channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 印度的 TikTok 粉丝仍在质疑政府 2020 年禁止该社交媒体应用程序的决定。它提供了一个案例研究，TikTok 在美国也面临着类似的威胁。
item.description:
TikTok fans in India still question the government’s 2020 decision to ban the social-media app. It offers a case study, with TikTok facing a similar threat in the U.S. https://t.co/lD88Y5IDVg https://t.co/lD88Y5IDVg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 要想知道哪位候选人将赢得总统大选，请使用政治分析家杰夫-格林菲尔德的预测模型：竞选中的兔八哥总能打败达菲鸭
item.description:
To figure out which candidate will win the presidential election, use political analyst Jeff Greenfield’s prediction model: The Bugs Bunny of the race always beats the Daffy Duck https://t.co/ZVJnc4NepZ https://t.co/ZVJnc4NepZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.description:

item.title: 换一份薪水较低的工作通常意味着要减少开支，但同时也能增加自由时间，平衡工作与生活。
item.description:
Switching to a job with a lower salary often means trimming your expenses, but it can come with a raise in free time and work-life balance https://t.co/bv3QTfLMAd pic.twitter.com/XMbRF2Dg6W

item.title: 随着安全风险的增加，美国及其盟国正在努力遣返 "伊斯兰国 "垮台后被关押在叙利亚东北部难民营和拘留中心的平民和武装分子。
item.description:
As security risks grow, the U.S. and its allies are struggling to repatriate civilians and militants held in refugee camps and detention centers in northeast Syria after the collapse of Islamic State https://t.co/ssfhqGaSjk https://t.co/ssfhqGaSjk

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: "要么你结束这一切，要么我走人"在华盛顿特区的一个富人区，一桩少棒丑闻让位高权重的家长们相互对立，并引发了一场大发现。
item.description:

item.title: 由于朝韩关系紧张，延坪岛上的恐惧正在加剧，这里距离朝鲜海岸不到两英里。"人们一直担心朝鲜可能发动袭击"
item.description:
With inter-Korean tensions high, fears are building on Yeonpyeong Island, less than 2 miles from North Korean shores. “There’s constant anxiety about a potential North Korean attack.” https://t.co/1dOHdQMpOV https://t.co/1dOHdQMpOV

item.title: 观看：WSJ 走进首尔郊外的一个地下掩体设施，一旦与金正恩政权开战，美国和韩国的军事行动将集中于此。
item.description:
Watch: WSJ goes inside an underground bunker facility outside of Seoul, where U.S. and South Korean military operations would be centralized in the event of a war with the Kim Jong Un regime. https://t.co/6HsmlBfKdH https://t.co/6HsmlBfKdH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 他曾是一名律师，生活在美国梦中。后来，精神疾病让他的聪明才智与自己背道而驰。"他的姐姐说："我们以为他会得到他需要的帮助。相反，他失去了一切。
item.description:
He was a lawyer living the American dream. Then mental illness turned his brilliant mind against him. “We thought he was going to get the help he needed,” his sister said. Instead, he lost it all. https://t.co/VPDournp5B https://t.co/VPDournp5B

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.description:

item.title: 莫斯科专制制度的支持者承诺它将提供安全保障。现在，克里姆林宫在国内面临伊斯兰恐怖主义，在国外则要面对一场代价高昂的战争。
item.description:
Supporters of Moscow’s authoritarian system pledged it would provide security. Now the Kremlin faces Islamist terrorism at home and a costly war abroad. https://t.co/xXqbKpfG4U https://t.co/xXqbKpfG4U

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 卡洛斯-塞恩斯（Carlos Sainz）被法拉利车队抛弃，随后被迫接受切除阑尾的紧急手术。他康复后赢得了澳大利亚大奖赛。
item.description:
Carlos Sainz was dumped by his Ferrari team, then forced to undergo emergency surgery to remove his appendix. He recovered to win the Australian Grand Prix. https://t.co/KK8gA9pWqF pic.twitter.com/jsgDPrgDVg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 从 8 美元的除臭剂到 46 美元一袋的狗粮，尽管出现了一些经济强劲的迹象，但基本商品价格的飙升仍让收银台前的消费者感到震惊

item.title: 宅在家里的闺蜜们在 TikTok 上上传了大量关于自我保健、烹饪、清洁的视频，以及对传统婚姻的理想化憧憬--少了结婚戒指
item.description:
Stay-at-home girlfriends have flooded TikTok with videos of self-care, cooking, cleaning and an idealized vision of a traditional marriage—minus the wedding ring https://t.co/pnRAq3R2xY https://t.co/pnRAq3R2xY

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: Discord 平台上的 Z 世代意外地找到了生活在数百或数千英里之外的浪漫伴侣。通过聊天，他们开始互访、见家长，甚至结婚。
item.description:
Gen Z’ers on the platform Discord are unexpectedly finding romantic partners who live hundreds or thousands of miles away. Chats are leading to visits, meeting the parents—even marriage. https://t.co/gJ5cGtV9Ja https://t.co/gJ5cGtV9Ja

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: "Girls5Eva》主演 Busy Philipps 谈及自己小时候的怪癖："我有很强的主见，很容易迷恋自己喜欢的东西，这让其他孩子感到焦虑，他们希望我像他们一样--安静、酷。
item.description:
"Girls5Eva" star Busy Philipps on embracing her weirdness as a kid: "I had strong opinions and easily became obsessed with things I liked, which caused anxiety in other kids who wanted me to be like them—quiet and cool." https://t.co/udizE6HU1g https://t.co/udizE6HU1g

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024
